author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Venus vs. the Virgin in ‘Tannhäuser’
text:
Venus vs. the Virgin in ‘Tannhäuser’ Oct 20, 2015 Photo by: Marty Sohl/Met Opera Johan Botha, takes on the title role of the young knight caught between true love and passion in Wagner’s “Tannhäuser” at the Metropolitan Opera. 
Rockland — The 2015-2016 Metropolitan Opera’s Live-in-HD season of broadcasts from Lincoln Center to the Strand Theatre, 345 Main St., continues Saturday, Oct. 31, at noon with Wagner’s “Tannhäuser.” An encore broadcast is set for Tuesday, Nov. 3, at noon. 
James Levine conducts Wagner’s early masterpiece in its first return to the Met stage in more than a decade. Contemporary leading Wagnerian tenor Johan Botha takes on the daunting title role opposite soprano Eva-Maria Westbroek as Elisabeth, adding another Wagner heroine to her Met repertoire after her acclaimed Sieglinde in the Ring a few seasons ago. On the heels of his recent triumph in “Parsifal,” baritone Peter Mattei sings Wolfram; and mezzo-soprano Michelle DeYoung is the love goddess, Venus. 
“Tannhäuser” is sung in German, with English subtitles, and runs about four hours and 20 minutes. Tickets are $27, $15 for those younger than 19 and college students with ID (call the box office to purchase tickets at the student price, 594-0070, ext. 3). Encore show tickets are available day-of-show for $23 and $5. Season ticket packages also are available. 
For more information about all upcoming live concerts, films, HD broadcasts and events at the Strand, visit rocklandstrand.com ; call 594-0070, ext. 3; or email info@rocklandstrand.com.
